title: Georginio Wijnaldum refusing to make excuses for Liverpool's slump - and sees defeats as motivation
text:
Wijnaldum is hopeful Liverpool's fortunes will turn around soon; (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Georginio Wijnaldum is refusing to make excuses for the slump that has all but ended Liverpool's title challenge. 
The Reds' only win since the turn of the year came in the FA Cup third round replay at League Two Plymouth Argyle. 
Liverpool have since slipped out of the top four for the first time since the third week of the Premier League season and are facing a fight for Champions League football. 
Defeats to Hull and Swansea in recent weeks have been coupled with a draw against Chelsea, as Jurgen Klopp's men have struggled to hit the heights of their early season expectation. 
But Wijnaldum is refusing to make excuses for the poor run of form. Wijnaldum gets a lift to training (Photo: CHRIS NEILL/MAVERICK PHOTOGRAPHY) Wijnaldum scored the equaliser in the draw against Chelsea (Photo: PA) He wants to now see Liverpool's form improve (Photo: Liverpool Echo) 
“People from outside ask us what the reason is that we’re not performing as good as before," he told LiverpoolFC.com. 
"They ask you is it [the number of] games that we’ve played, because we’ve played a lot of games in a row – but other teams have had the same and didn’t drop points, and we did. 
“Sometimes you’re in a flow and sometimes not. We’re in a situation where we’re not in a flow, but we must have confidence and faith we can change it. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
